Plant-based protein sources: In addition to vitamins and minerals, plant-based protein sources like legumes, nuts, and seeds would also be crucial for maintaining a balanced diet. These can be used as a substitute for fruits and vegetables.
Fungi and algae: Fungi and algae are also sources of essential vitamins and minerals, and they can be cultivated and consumed as an alternative to fruits and vegetables.

Urban agriculture: With the disappearance of fruits and vegetables, urban agriculture would become even more important. This would involve growing food in city environments, using rooftops and other available spaces.
Aquaponics: Aquaponics is a system that combines aquaculture and hydroponics. This method can be used to grow fish and plants simultaneously, providing a sustainable source of food and nutrients.

Fermentation: Fermentation can be used to preserve and enhance the nutritional value of fruits and vegetables. This method would allow people to store and consume fruits and vegetables that are no longer fresh, while also creating new food products.
